title: Riot a bunch of cucks
body: Seriously you cant even trash talk in this game. Not even a little bit wtf is wrong with you insecure pussies that you give people chat restrictions and a 14 day ban for me calling someone a cuck and that theyre bad at the game? Especially when a guy on my team told me to kill myself 3 times and bet no punishment was done lol.  What a joke you guys are that decide punishments for people get out in the real world you fucking pussies, people talk shit get over it.

It's not that we can't handle it, we would just prefer not to play with someone who is only interested in spouting insults and nonsense whenever things go bad for them. If you can't or won't interact with others in a neutral or positive manner then multiplayer online games are not for you. From [Ulanopo's Knowledge Base](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4086541&page=1#post43465401): 

>**People who report are simply being oversensitive. The mute button exists for a reason.**

>Lets start with the Riot quote on this (link (http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=30696571#post30696571)):

>_**Why is verbal abuse punishable if there is a mute button/language filter?**
Players shouldnt need to rely on features like the mute button or language filter to engage with other players in positive ways. When a player verbally abuses another player and forces him to use the mute button, they have already created a negative experience for that player._

>Simply put, Riot says no. You can scream and cry all you want, but it is their house and their rules.

>With that out of the way, I think the topic deserves some further discussion. The theory is that, if people resolved to care less, then they would be happier. I often refer to this as Argument from Stoicism and I think it is a fairly weak philosophy because it places the burden on the person being expected to endure the behavior rather than the person exhibiting the behavior. You should be able to handle it is just a flimsy excuse for being a bully or a jerk. I have to be the bigger man so that you can do whatever you want? That hardly seems fair.

>There is also the issue of how I spend my limited free time. Like most people, I am constantly required to make value judgments between the different forms of entertainment that are available to me and, let's be honest, we live in an age of nearly limitless entertainment options. If I'm having a bad day in League, I can just fire up Steam and play a whole bunch of games that don't require me to put up with someone's BS.

>This is not an issue of weakness or thin-skin; it's a question of choosing activities that don't leave me feeling frustrated and angry. Too many of those experiences and I'll just find something else to do. Riot knows this.

Well League of Legends is a different game and as such has different rules than other games you may have played. Not only that but many games are following Riots lead and are cracking down on jerks within their games.

>What I find funny is how this community promotes kids that intent feed and troll purposely yet will insta ban someone for being "toxic".

All forms of toxicity are punished, but things like gameplay trolling and intentional feeding often require manual reviews since the IFS has to be sure that the person in question is actually trolling rather than just having a bad game or two. Don't believe me? Well [here is](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/sU5wOfFJ-proof-that-the-automated-system-is-broken?show=rundown) one such example of that happening. Yes it's just one example, but it proves that they do get punished.

Not only that, but the people punished for this stuff usually know why they were punished and as such rarely come here to complain about their bans, hence why we see more people complaining about verbal abuse bans more than anything else.

>Sorry but I'm pretty sure the people who are toxic and or just trash talking are actually playing to WIN like a competitive environment is supposed to be and atleast not losing intentionally.

You can play to win without being a jerk to people when things don't go your way. In fact, many professional League of Legends players have been punished for poor behavior. You can see some examples of them [here](http://lol.esportspedia.com/wiki/List_of_Competitive_Rulings).
